course.subject: CORE
course.name: Energy and Related Environmental Issues
course.description: This course will introduce the basic concepts of the physical principles behind energy. Forms of energy (including fossil energy, nuclear energy and various forms of renewable energy) and their use for electricity generation, as well as their impacts on the environment from both global and regional perspectives will be covered. Issues related to energy conservation and related environmental issues in Hong Kong and the rest of the world will be addressed.
course.prerequisites: a passing letter grade in CORE 1401 OR CORE 1402 OR CORE 1403 OR CORE 1404 OR LANG 1002 (prior to 2022-23)

reviews.author: Silas_L
reviews.comment_content:
The basic concepts of the physical principles behind energy. Forms of energy and their use for electricity generation, as well as their impacts on the environment from both global and regional perspectives.
Issues related to energy conservation and related environmental issues in Hong Kong and the rest of the world.
L1: Introduction
L2: Population growth and Energy consumption
L3 ~ L10: Fossil fuels
L11~ L15: Electircity
L16~ L17: Nuclear energy
L18: Water energy
L19: Wind energy
L20: Solar energy
L21: Air pollution
L22: Global warming and Climate change
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor Wang spoke very slowly with a strong accent, so sometimes it might be hard to understand what he had said. The Professor usually read the powerpoint and add some of his own opinion. I must say that I haven't serious hear about any lecture because the ppt shows all points in detail. During the class, IPRS and tutorial questions will be presented. The IPRS question is pretty easy while the tutorial questions are sometimes hard to tackle. However, the answers can be found by looking through the ppt.
reviews.comment_grading:
Final Exam - 50%
IPRS quizzes during lecture time - 4% (L5-L22)
Multiple-choice questions during tutorial sessions - 10% (L5-L22)
Written report of an open-ended question – 18%
Group project (oral presentation) – 18%

My grades are showed below:
Final Exam: 104/120 Mean: 74.9 High: 114
IPRS quizzes: 22/22
Multiple choices: 39/44
Written repot: 91/100 Mean: 79.5 High: 91
Group Project: 81/100 Mean: 78.7 High: 88

Final Grade: A+
The final grade is astounding nice cause I expect to get an A or A-.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload of this course is extremely light except the last month of semester because this course have no homework and little assignments. However most assignments are in need to be finished in the last month including written report and group project.
